Reviews.Title: “You can get anywhere in Chicago from here!”
Reviews.Author: yolos
Reviews.Content: I had no idea where to stay on my first trip to Chicago. Finding an apartment for my daughter was the goal and so I wanted a hotel close to public transportation. I am glad we decided to stay at City Suites. The train station is right next door and you can connect to all the different lines that will take you in every direction. Noise wasn't a problem for us but maybe that was because our room didn't face the train platform. Regardless, the hotel is very nice, the staff exceptionally friendly and helpful and the rooms provided plenty of room with two separate areas, each one with its own flat screen TV. There is free wifi, a mini bar, refrigerator and all the other usual amenities. The free continental breakfast offered everything we wanted and was well maintained. There is coffee and hot water 24/7 and fresh cookies in the afternoon. The lounge with fireplace provided a quiet spot to read and relax. I have only two complaints: Housekeeping often didn't get to make up our room until quite late in the afternoon even though the "Housekeeping Please" tag was hung on our door early each morning. The wall air conditioners were old, a little noisy and didn't quite cool down the room to my satisfaction. The ceiling fans helped but I like a REALLY cool room. Overall, City Suites is a very good hotel and I will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Loud but nice”
Reviews.Author: TijuanaJuan
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a room on the front side of the hotel on the second floor. It was a nice, clean, and comfortable room but was very noisy. The train station next door meant that late at night and early in the morning you could hear the train and the announcements. The radiator in the bathroom made lots of noises through the night as well. My room was small, but well furnished. I am not a light sleeper and was very tired the week that I stayed here so all the noise didn't bother me too much, but this is something to keep in mind if noise keeps you awake.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint and comfortable with lovely staff”
Reviews.Author: sasandtim
Reviews.Content: My family recently stayed at the City Suites and found it to be just lovely. The standard rooms are rather small, my husband and I upgraded to a suite which was spacious and comfortable though not especially stylish or trendy. A few upsides that we found include: --the fabulous shower: I honestly can't remember the last time I had a shower that great (other than at home!) --The location: if you want to be near Lakeview and right on the L, this is a great option. It also close to things like a frozen yogurt shop, a Jamba Juice, a Potbelly, Ann Sathers, etc... --There is a lovely "living room" where we spent time relaxing - coffee and tea all day, a microwave, a fireplace and cookies in the afternoon, it was very cozy and comfortable. --A basic breakfast is included with the room and wifi is free! --The staff were really helpful and eager to please! The only downside I can think of is that it was a bit noisy - we could hear people talking both in the hallway outside our room and also outside on the street. My uncle's room was on the other side of the hallway from ours and he said that he could hear the announcement from the platform of the L... That said, if you don't mind a bit of noise, it's great value for the price!

Reviews.Title: “Great New Years Eve in the Windy City”
Reviews.Author: psasquatch99
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay at the City Suites Hotel, Staff very friendly and helpful from check in till check out. Room very comfortable, up & down side to this hotel is it proximity to the L (maybe 100’), we could hear they platform announcements from our room, if you are a light sleeper this will most likely be a problem for you and I recommend staying somewhere else. The heat situation in the rooms with the radiators was a bit of an issue, not knowing a 100% how they work it did make the room temperature a little tricky to regulate. To me these minor issues would not keep me from stay at this hotel again (I will be staying here again in the spring to go to a Cubs game).

Reviews.Title: “Girls Trip!!!”
Reviews.Author: Kyle M
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a day and night at City Suites Hotel with my Best friend and twin brother. Had a wonderful time! Love Chicago and Love City Suites Hotel. Coming back Soon!

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: kcbeefy
Reviews.Content: My partner and I recently stayed at the City Suites for a long weekend getaway.We got a great rate on their website, $89 a night for a King Suite. The hotel is conveniently located next to the red line stop at Belmont. We called ahead and requested a room on the quiet side of the hotel and of course when we checked in the only available room was on the side next to the train tracks. The room was comfortable and clean but we defiantly heard the train all night long.The suite consistent of two rooms, the living room had a couch, mini refrigerator and a desk. The king bed and pillows were comfy. There was an all night party going on in one or two of the rooms on our floor which also spilled out into the hallway which went on until about 5 AM. So between the train and the party we didn't get much sleep the first night. The staff at the front desk agreed to move us to another room on the quiet side for the rest of our stay. The new room was very quiet however there was a problem with heat, it wouldn't turn off so it felt like we were in a sauna. Our trip was in the middle of December and we had to run the air-condition on high to keep the temperature comfortable. Seems like a big waste of energy. The hotel offers free wireless in the rooms and also free breakfast.This was a big plus and the breakfast was really good and consisted of juice, milk, coffee, hot tea and hot chocolate, cereal, fruit cups, yogurt, doughnuts,Danishes, muffins, hard boiled eggs and Jimmy Dean breakfast sandwiches. The hotel is a great locations for those visiting the bars and clubs in boystown. Lots of great restaurants are right outside the door. The staff was very friendly and helpful. We would defiantly stay here again if the price was right.

Reviews.Title: “Your money's worth and more”
Reviews.Author: bonniegw
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed at City Suites in September during a Bridal Market at the Merchandise Mart. Very clean room and bathroom. Comfy beds, nice complimentary breakfast in a.m. Staff extremely attentive and helpful. Sitting area separate from sleeping area. Lots of good reasonable restaurants within walking distance (went to the Thai place twice). The hotel is a 30 second walk to an EL station and the train gets you right into the station to the Merchandise Mart. The hotel is not downtown, kind of a neighborbood but seemed very safe. Free wi-fi @ hotel. Will definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great location & very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: kasinger
Reviews.Content: This boutique hotel was in a great location. It is a 10 min walk to Wrigley Field and the train station is just outside the door. The staff is extremely friendly and helpful. The breakfast has a good variety of items to eat in a living room type setting. My favorite part was the size of the rooms! The rooms with two double beds also include a living room area with a pull out sofa bed. This room can sleep 6 people and was reasonably priced, about $220 w/ taxes. If you can, ask for a room that is not on the side of the building that has the train station or you will have noise from the train and the PA system at the station. I was worried about it waking me up, but to my surprise, I slept all through the night. The only reason I am not giving this hotel 5 stars is because of the train. I will use this hotel again! Loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Thanks for the great stay!”
Reviews.Author: Rick A
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a jewel tucked into a unique neighborhood. Clean and comfortable.The staff is helpful, friendly, knowledgeable. the rail system and parking are feet away. Plenty of good eateries near by. The hotel is small but quaint. Well worth the rate. For my brother and I it was a very nice stay!!!

Reviews.Title: “Old but ok”
Reviews.Author: Zackdft
Reviews.Content: This hotel is an old building with a makeover. It looks nice at a first glance but when your laying in your bed trying to sleep and the floor above you is non stop squeaking because instead of updating anything real they just put down new carpet and paint. But a lot of the cuteness of this hotel is how old the building is. So you get what you are thinking. I would stay here again if no newer hotels are available. Internet is painfully slow and the elevator only holds two people at a time.

Reviews.Title: “great time”
Reviews.Author: Patricia948
Reviews.Content: nice hospitality of the staff.....i have a great time staying to your hotel for a week. it's very near to the Belmont station which make it as a perfect location for travelers. thank you guys!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good choice for us.”
Reviews.Author: Kcitytraveler
Reviews.Content: I stayed several nights while visiting my daughter, who lives nearby. The hotel entrance is under a black awning just a few steps from the train. The street is bustling but easy to navigate. The hotel staff,overall,was very friendly. I was happy with our room; it wasn't huge but definitely large enough for two. I liked the short wall dividing the sitting area from the beds. Noise was not a problem for us; we slept well. The room was pretty tidy and the beds were comfortable. Our ceiling fan was a tad noisy but was fine. We enjoyed the continental breakfast every morning, and appreciated being able to take a tray back to our room if we wanted.(But the hotel lobby was a fun scene; I met some cool people!) It was great to have parking around the block and worth the price. I liked staying here and plan on visiting City Suites again when in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly and helpful staff, perfect room for the money.”
Reviews.Author: tonyvski
Reviews.Content: I loved our room in this centrally located, well-appointed, well-staffed, friendly, lively-yet-intimate hotel. It's exactly where we wanted to be and how we wanted to stay the night in Chicago. I am relocating to Chicago soon, but, until I do, whenever I plan on being in the city, I'll be checking availability first at the City Suites Hotel before anywhere else. I highly recommend this wonderful little hotel!

Reviews.Title: “City Suites/Chicago”
Reviews.Author: Cubfan9348
Reviews.Content: The location of City Suites was perfect. We had a short walk to Wrigley Field. The hotel was comfortable and the rooms were adequate. For any baseball fan I would recommend staying at City Suites on West Belmont in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Our 2nd stay”
Reviews.Author: BeckyNeville
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at City Suites twice when visiting our kids in Chicago. We love the location in Lakeview. The staff is very helpful. The downstairs lobby is very comfortable for enjoying the wonderful continental breakfast. The rooms are clean and comfortable. Make sure to ask for a room not facing the Red Line. We will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for business in Lakeview or Lincoln Park areas”
Reviews.Author: Chipndale69
Reviews.Content: Have stayed in this hotel a number of times, always for personal stay as my daughter lives in this part of town. It's very nice if you don't mind the older style, city hotels. Pleasant staff, clean place, not beautiful or elegant, but nice enough and fairly reasonably priced, again, for a downtown/city hotel. I have used others over the years but I think this place does a good job.

Reviews.Title: “location! but some noise”
Reviews.Author: talkingtocactus
Reviews.Content: the hotel is really well located - right next to belmont red line station. just be warned that this does mean that in rooms at the front you can hear the trains coming in and out of the station, and even the bells ringing to signify the doors closing. i found this oddly comforting but it may not be to everyone's taste. there are some quite noisy shops near the hotel too (for instance forever yogurt in the ground floor, open til 2am, and plays music) but it's a busy neighbourhood so these are to be expected to an extent. again, this hotel may not be to everyone's taste if they prefer a quieter neighbourhood but if you want to feel like you're in the thick of things it's great. the room was good, comfortable, had everything i needed - cleanliness could've been a tad better and some of the fittings were quite old, but neither were bad enough to be a problem. the reception staff were excellent, very friendly and helpful. for a short stay, and if you need easy access to central chicago, i'd definitely recommend it (the station was on the doorstep with L trains to the loop area every few mins, the journey taking about 10 mins) and in the other direction, very close to wrigley field so ideal for cubs games.

Reviews.Title: “Labor Day weekend stay at the City Suites Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Traveler1966_MI
Reviews.Content: We booked the CSH based upon the mostly positive Tripadvisor reviews, it's proximity to the "L", as well as being close to the Halstead area. We checked in and were given a room on the "quiet" side, but once we got to the room, we realized we were on top of the yogurt shop which plays loud music, and is open past midnight, and heard the music below us. We requested another room, and we relocated to another room, on the "quiet" side, but it was at the south end of the hotel which was still close to the train. The noise wasn't too bad, especially with the air conditioner on. We had a queen suite, which was nice and big. The bed was soft and plush, and had a good nights sleep. We didn't partake in the free continental breakfast,, so can't comment on that. Parking was $22/day, and it is in a secure garage about a block away, with in/out priviledges. Staff was nice, and accommodating. Went to a few places around the hotel for breakfast or lunch. Sinbad's Middle Eastern food a few doors down was good for lunch. Ann Sathers for breakfast was OK... not quiet as good as all of the hype. Overall, the CSH was a great place due to it's proximity to the train which was a great benefit, and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Will definetely stay here for future visits. Highly recommend it.”
Reviews.Author: kenpoguy
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because of its location and the fact that it offered free breakfast (its quite a savings when you're travelling with growing children) but were pleasantly surprised that it offerered more than what we had hoped for. The room had several snacks and beverages (non-alcholic as well as alcholic) and it operated on a honor system. You report only what you had consumed. Nobody was there to monitor what you took or did not take. Very impressed. The best thing about this hotel is one of its staff member named Ben. On our very first day, on the way to hotel, my daughter had left her cell phone and ipod in the cab. Needless ot say, it was a stressful moment as we did not know how to go about retrieving it. Ben was there to calm us down and went above and beyond to help us locate it. Besides the hotel itself, I was extremely impressed by the citizens of Chicago. The lady who had found my daughters phone went out of her way to call the contacts on my daughter's phone and even dropped the phone and ipod to our hotel when she found out where were staying. Unfortunately, she did not leave behind her name and contacts, so we could not thank her personally. So, lady, whoever and wherever you may be, a BIG THANK YOU to you. You have definelty restored our faith in humanity and have indeed represented the city of Chicago in a very positive light. As for the location of the hotel itself., This hotel could not have been more ideally located for people who likes to explore a new city using Mass Transit. Its located right at the foot of the Belmont CTA red line, yet there was no noise from this at night. On our last day in Chicago, we decided to explore the neighborhood by foot and and were amazed at the vibrancy and diversity it offered. Right next to the hotel was a Thai, Mid-Eastern, and Indian Restaurant in a row. Then there was "Ann Stathers", which offered one of the best breakfast and brunches we've ever had. Further down the road, there was some Chinese reataurants, several fast food restaturants. A Marshalls, DSW Shoe warehouse and Sports Authority all there just around the corner. And best of all, for sports fans, Wrigley Field was just one stop north of the this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Conflicting Feelings”
Reviews.Author: Phillygwm
Reviews.Content: Usually when I stay at a hotel, I have strong positive or negative feelings about it. While I REALLY liked certain aspects of this hotel, there were some aspects that travelers need to be aware of. First, the positives: it's a great location, maybe 100 feet from the Belmont El station. It's only a moderate walk to Wrigley Field and it's in Boystown, if you're a gay traveler. The staff was unfailingly friendly and competent. The room itself was quaint; this is an old property but not shabby in any way. You'll see radiators and window A/C units in the rooms -- not a central controller! -- but it's very well maintained. Downsides: being next to the El station means, every 5-10 minutes, you're next to the El. If you're a light sleeper, you'll have a major problem! I'm not sure if quieter rooms exist. The wifi was not always reliable though generally it wasn't horrible. Not all the TV stations were functional but you're not likely there to watch TV.

Reviews.Title: “Great place and location”
Reviews.Author: TexCubFan
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at City Suites. Even after reading reviews about noise from the El, we hardly heard anything. We walked short distance to Wrigley Field to watch Cubs and Yankees during Father's Day weekend. The hotel staff was friendly and helpful recommending restaraunts and bars in the area. With the El close by, it was very convenient to hop on for ride to Downtown sites. We would definitely stay at City Suites Hotel again on our next trip to Chicago for a Cub game.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Judge A Book By It's Cover”
Reviews.Author: sdtravelguy
Reviews.Content: I had not been to this hotel in almost 18 years, but remember it was a good place back then to stay if you needed to be near the "L" and Boystown. I was there with my partner and when he saw the place from the outside he was not thrilled. But, once inside and greeted by a nice front desk agent, his attitude changed. The hotel is clean, lobby is decorated well and the rooms are very nice. We opted for the suite, which was only $15 more and it was roomy, clean, fully furnished and quiet. Even though this hotel is right next to the elevated train, it is very quiet. There are plenty of restaurants in the area and easy to get places. I would fully recommend this hotel to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a great area”
Reviews.Author: trip_AJD
Reviews.Content: We had a 'Suite with Queen bed' room that was furnished nicely and had all the amenities we needed, two flat screen TV's, desk, sofa, wardrobe. The suite room had plenty of space for 2 guests and was very clean. The bathroom was decoratively tiled in black and white and was very roomy. Breakfast consisted of tea, coffee, fruit juices, yoghurts, bagels and pastries. We loaded a tray each morning and headed back to the room for breakfast in bed as the reception room is a little small. The hotel is next to the Belmont CTA ('El') red line station which is great for getting into downtown (they're every 10mins during the day and cost about $2.50 each per ride - buy a pre-paid card in the station as this is way easier. It takes about 10mins to get into downtown). Although the hotel is close to the station, we had very minimal noise in our room. We could hear the station announcements if we opened our bathroom window and kept quiet, but we didn't have any sleep/other issues from this as we could close the window and the bathroom door during the night. The big plus about this hotel is the location. It's a couple of blocks from North Clark Street, which has some great bars and restaurants. Most notably, El Jardin, which served the best Mexican food we've ever tasted, and for very cheap too. We walked all around the area (Wrigleyville) from the hotel and notable places of interest were; Wrigley Field (10min walk), the Belmont Harbour (20min walk).

Reviews.Title: “left hotel earlier than booked”
Reviews.Author: brigittem_11
Reviews.Content: Service very polite, nice, helpful Room small, dark, bad smell, very noisy because trains pass very close location far from city center, next to underground station breakfast self service in lobby to take into room

Reviews.Title: “Nice room and location was perfect”
Reviews.Author: LuvsQuilts
Reviews.Content: Read the reviews before booking about the sound from the Metro but decided that the benefits to being so close to the station outweighed the risk of hearing the trains. Our room was on the third floor and the opposite side of the hotel so I didn't hear the train at all. My husband reported hearing it once or twice during the middle of the night but it wasn't a problem with the fan on. The room was cozy but not too small. It was clean with a sleeping and living area. The parking is off site but not too far a walk, just around the corner. All staff we interacted with were nice. Other reviews report rudeness at the front desk but we didn't experience that at all. There is a continental breakfast offered daily which looked fine but we opted to eat breakfast at a nice place a few doors down the street. Will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, amenities, staff, and hotel and I will definitely be back.”
Reviews.Author: abt8786
Reviews.Content: My stay at the City Suites hotel was outstanding. The front desk staff were very friendly and helped me find some great restaurants to go to. The housekeepers greeted me in the hallways and the bellmen were there for anything else I needed. My friend is a light sleeper and we were put near the train but we called down to the front desk and they were able to move us to the quiet side. If you are used to living in a city then being close to the train should not bother you. The breakfast was perfect, just the right amount of different options to get our day started off on a good step. The room was very clean and the beds were just right. The wide variety of restaurants and shops near the hotel was great. Also, Wrigley Field is a 10 minute walk, can't beat that! My friends and I will definitely be back soon!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Decent Location, Unfriendly Deskstaff”
Reviews.Author: travelguy73
Reviews.Content: All of us, overall, enjoyed our stay at City Suites when we were here on business at stage 773. The rooms were clean and well kept and had phenomenal beds, but lacked the unique character an Inn should have. The mini-bar in room was overly stocked with chintzy souvenirs and took up valuable space, but overall the layout was workable. The electronics and appliances were nicely updated and the bath products and bedding were excellent. There is not outlet by the sink, so plan on awkwardly plugging things in if you require blow-dryers, curling irons, or flat-irons. I should mention though that the deskstaff from start to finish were rude and distant. The overly complicated checkin process and unwelcoming demeanor of the front desk caused some initial stress, but this was lifted once we were able to access all of our reservations and finally checkin to the rooms. The last thing people want after a long day of traveling is a complicated checkin. The bellstaff was very helpful in delivering our bags, but unfortunately the parking situation is less than ideal because its in a garage a couple blocks away that requires a access wand (that is $200 to replace if something happens to it). Hopefully you don't have the misfortune of losing it. Just a minor complaint as there is not much the hotel can do to improve this except valet service, which is expensive. Breakfast was also crowded and mediocre. The pastries were gordon's food service quality at best and the coffee was absolutely terrible. The 7/11 microwave breakfast sandwiches didn't help to sell the quality either. My best summary is that... its nice, but nothing special with some minor annoyances.

Reviews.Title: “Great location & service. Expensive parking.”
Reviews.Author: Nprbuff777
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a place to stay in the city that was affordable and near Lakeview. This hotel has a great European feel. The staff -- especially Sandoor and Jeremy -- were helpful, courteous and went out of their way to help us feel comfortable. If you are a AAA member, there's a 10-percent discount, which is great. PROS: Quaint, comfortable, clean room. Nicely furnished. Flat screen TV. Close to Lakeview/Lincoln park/Wrigleyville/Boystown. Room service menu with burgers, soups available at affordable prices. Free wifi. Free coffee/tea/hot chocolate available 24 hours. Free newspapers. Great lobby area with fireplace. Helpful staff. CONS: Not the quietest place. Expensive parking ($22 a day with in/our privileges); spotty wifi. Hard to control room temperatures because of radiator heat. Thanks to the reviews here, we asked for a room on the quiet side and on the top floor. Amy was great in helping us book the room. But, as others have said, the sound proofing isn't the best and we could still hear the train and the train announcements all the time in addition to the person in the room next door coughing. However, it wasn't unbearable. The hotel is close to one of the busiest gay bars in Chicago, but we didn't hear much noise coming from there, even with the window open. Overall a great place to stay if you are not a light sleeper.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible staff and broken appliances”
Reviews.Author: Iowa7
Reviews.Content: When I booked my room, the desk clerk I spoke to was very unhelpful and unfriendly, but I thought nothing of it until after our stay. Upon entering our room at the hotel, we discovered that the room was hot and stuffy. We turned the window air conditioner on, but nothing happened. I called the front desk and requested a room change, since we wanted to relax and did not want to have repairmen in our room. We had just arrived and it was very early (a little after 3:00), but we were told that we could not change rooms because "the hotel is fully booked." I pointed out that most of the evenings guests had certainly not arrived yet, but the desk clerk was very abrupt and would not budge. We sat awkwardly in our room as the repairman tested the air conditioner, removed it from the window, and then went to get another (used) one to install. Then we turned it on, unpacked, changed clothes and went out to get a meal. Upon our return, the replacement air conditioner had also stopped working. We called the front desk, and magically, they could now move us to another room. So we re-packed and moved. The several hours of needless annoyance got our trip off to a very bad start. Finally, the air conditioner worked in the new room, but it made an assortment of loud and annoying noises during the night that kept waking us up. We assumed that complaining about it would be a waste of time, and just reconciled ourselves with sleeping badly for our stay. The night before checking out, we called to get a late checkout and were told to call back in the morning. In the morning, my wife called to request late checkout again, and the desk clerk said, "No later than noon!" and hung up. At 11:20 the desk clerk called our room and rudely informed us that if we did not leave soon, we would be charged for an additional day. I was furious at the lack of service and the extremely rude and inconsiderate way we were treated, and it started the day very badly. I have never been treated with such disdain at a hotel, and the attitude seemed to be the norm for their desk clerks. I hope they re-evaluate their customer service training. I need to note, however, that one person there was extremely friendly and helpful. The bellman, Brian, was sent up to help with the replacement of the air conditioner, and he--unlike everybody else at the hotel--"gets it." He was extremely personable and seemed to be genuinely concerned about resolving the problems so our stay would be enjoyable. Unfortunately, his valiant efforts were overwhelmed by the rest of the staff. I like the location of this hotel, and it's got its own niche in the area, but we won't be returning.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value, Location and Service”
Reviews.Author: nsidecolab
Reviews.Content: Great location and friendly staff. Many food, beverage and shopping options in walking distance. Steppenwolf is 3 L stops away. Would definitely stay again. Ask for the quiet side of the Hotel (or you will hear Belmont station announcements all night). Side opposite elevator pretty quiet.

Reviews.Title: “2nd Visit Out of Infinite Future Visits”
Reviews.Author: MrCMartin
Reviews.Content: I have been to Chicago about a dozen times, and I have stayed at many locations. This hotel has served me the best for all my Chicago trips. I say that because this was my second stay, but it sure won't be the last. Let's start with location as this little boutique hotel is situated on the edge of Boys Town in the heart of the Belmont area. It is conveniently located next to the Belmont El Train stop on the Red Line. It is within walking distance to lots of great restaurants for eating, tons of shopping in the Belmont area, Wrigley Field, and, of course, Boys Town where many events happen all year long. During this particular trip, Maket Days was the main event, and with the hotel being so closeby, we were able to party and drink up the festivities without worrying about having to catch a cab or bus back to the hotel. Being so close the Red Line that runs 24 hours a day made it very convenient to travel downtown or other parts of the city. I don't think you could ask for a better location. The hotel itself is excellent from its cute covered doorway to the large mirrors that line the hallways to the welcoming lobby and staff. The hotel clerks and bellhops were always friendly and jovial, and I can't remember a time when I didn't pass by without hearing a "Hello!" or some other greeting. The maids were also very friednly and helpful, and they always made sure I had coffee when I requested it, which is a plus in my book since I drink it all day long. Like the lobby, the elevator, staircase, and hallways were always kept clean. The room was small but had a very plush queen size bed with a window air conditioning unit, two night stands, a business desk, a tall armoire for clothes, and a decent sized flat screen tv. I have to say that I loved how comfy the bed was, but it really made for a sore back in the morning. The bathroom was very nice with shiny white tile and glass block in the shower, which contained fragrant set of shower gel, shampoo, and conditioner. It also had fragrant lotion for those who need a little moisturizer to start their day. As for downsides, the room was on the side facing the El Train. So, one would think that noise was an issue, but I did not find that to be the case. Sure, I could hear it, but the noise was not overbearing, and the air conditioner actually drowned out most of the noise. I would also point out that the room came with very thick curtains to block out light, but since they were so long, they also covered the air conditioner. I'll just try to post them up around the air conditioner next time. Overall, I give this hotel two thumbs up, and I would recommend it to anyone visiting Chicago!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location/Service with Modern Style”
Reviews.Author: roadtripphene
Reviews.Content: There's really no other way to say it: you just really need to stay here when you're in Boys Town. I highly recommend it based on these redeeming factors: 1) The hotel is on a very fun, interesting street with lots of unique shops and restaurants. We could view the L Train from our windows, but rarely heard the train itself; the A/C maintained some nice (but not abrasive) white noise. The station was right next to the hotel. 2) The room's design and amenities were fantastic; containing a lot of modern features, from the flat-screen TV and mounted DVD to the glass block windows in the bathroom. The awesome-smelling eucalyptus shower gel/shampoo were provided via dispensers and the shower head and pressure were great. 3) The service at City Suites was much-appreciated. The front desk clerks were friendly and welcoming; we rarely got past the front desk without a greeting from either the bellhop or the clerks. They were informative and very helpful. A light continental breakfast with assorted cereals, pastry and juices was provided. The only disappointing aspect of my stay at City Suites unfortunately had to do with the quality of sleep there. Don't get me wrong; the bedding was comfortable with its down comforter and several pillows. However, the reader should note that the mattress is an EXTREMELY plush pillow-top. I woke up each morning with a slight backache; if you have back problems like I do, it may pose a problem for a long-term stay. Still, for our three nights at the hotel, I was extremely pleased and would stay there again, if given the opportunity. This hotel has it all: location, cleanliness, service and quality.

Reviews.Title: “Nice gem near Wrigley Field”
Reviews.Author: rrobson
Reviews.Content: We were looking for something close to Wrigley but what we found was a nice hotel within walking distance to everything. Great neighborhood...close to shops, waterfront, restaurants, and bars. We loved this place and would stay again. We had a room outside of the el but we barely heard it.

Reviews.Title: “STAY DOWNTOWN Quick 10 min train ride to Belmont DON'T WASTE $ OR RUIN YOUR TRIP”
Reviews.Author: 1worldtraveler3
Reviews.Content: We made a horrible mistake booking a so called "suite" here...Very dirty old funky place...Extreme Noise & uncomfortable room/bed was so bad our first night we checked out & for less $ got a great on line deal at a beautiful downtown hotel in the River North area right by the train (El) stop near shops restaurants bars right downtown...Every time we wanted to go out in Lakeview, Wrigleyville, Boystown, Lincoln Park,..etc...we just jumped on the train and within minutes we were out having fun! Again, Don't waste your $ and ruin your trip staying in this dump!

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: schmoaholic
Reviews.Content: A group of friends and I booked this hotel for a game at Wrigley. The location was great, it was probably a 10 minute walk to the game. There are tons of bars and things to do close to this hotel. The rooms were very clean as the hotel was as a whole. We had two double beds and a pull out bed, which was nice for the extra people in our group. The room was kind of divided into two seperate rooms. The complementary breakfast was what you would expect, but there is really nowhere to sit to eat it. Overall a good stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in boystown for a fair price”
Reviews.Author: blaze83
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed staying at this hotel basically because it is right at the south end of boystown and the fun is within walking distance. The metro is right next to the hotel, which is great but it can also be a problem sometimes because it can get noisy. If you want to have fun in boystown this is a really good choice for a fair price. It doesnt make sense to stay in the loop area (downtown) if you are planning to party in boystown at nite. The room was clean, I was surprised that the minibar had goods with pretty much market value; they weren't overpriced as in most hotels, so it was great not to worry about the price of the bottled water in your room. The hotel includes a pass to Bally total fitness, which is a five-minute walk away from there. I really liked that because most hotels than include a "gym" in their amenities usually have just a treadmill and some dumbells. When you stay at the City suites you get to go to a real gym, so that worked really good for me. What I didn't like was breakfast; it was just ok with unhealthy options except for the hard-boiled eggs. Overall, I really enjoyed this hotel and would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “funky boutique hotel in funky close in neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: Dressygirl
Reviews.Content: my niece recommended the City Suites Hotel as it was close to her apartment and DePaul University, and literally right next to the Belmont (Red/Brown) train station. Don't make the mistake and get off at the Blue station Belmont stop, it is about 35 blocks from the stop. However, if you do, take the 77 bus that goes directly up and down Belmont Ave. and runs quite frequently. To return to O'Hare I took the 77 bus to the other Belmont station and it was only 8 stops to O'Hare, saving lots of time. The City Suites Hotel was very clean, nice people working there, and on a major street (Belmont Ave) in Lakeview, a trendy neighborhood about six blocks from the lake and direclty on a metro line that would take you downtown. We had a room with a separate small living area (206) that had wonderful bedding (extremely comfortable beds), what looked to be a renovated bathroom with nice products and thick towels, two HD TVs, and a more than reasonable honor bar. They offiered Sterling Merlot wine for $15/bottle, which sold for $15.48 at the liquor store across the street. Canned beers of Miller Lite were $2, and downstairs they were selling large candy bars and Altoids for $1 (Altoids go for $1.99 at the CVS). The continental breakfast was free, and quite nice. Several cereal choices, a mixture of donuts, bagels, danish and muffins, coffee, tea and hot chocolate. There was also a microwave where you could heat up egg sandwiches (we didn't try any of those). There is also an rather well known restaurant a few doors down called Ann Sanders (?) that had terrific cinnamon rolls and breakfast. The hotel is within walking distance of Wrigley Field, and there are plenty of sports bars and restaurants in the area. We ate at Nuevo Mexicano at 2914 Clark, which was terrific, after finding a recommendation on OpenTable.com While our room was quiet and looked out over a brick building, my sister and brother in law stayed in Room 224, and could hear the constance noice of the automated speaker announcing trains coming in and out of Belmont. They got used to it, but I would suggest avoiding that room Overall, a terrific value ($159 night before the various taxes), friendly staff, nice free breakfast, very comfortable beds, sheets, pillows and towels, close to metro to take you downtown, and in a neat neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “It's like staying at my house, only more fun”
Reviews.Author: greenBeem
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel. I've stayed here twice, and will again the next time I stay in the city. It is comfortable, safe, tastefully decorated, has up-to-date amenities and is in a good location. A coworker found this place for me, so we could carpool on our way to work in south Chicago (she stays with friends in Wrigleyville). It looked like a nice place on the website, and the price was right - under $100 for a weeknight room. There's parking onsite, but I didn't use it. The area (Belmont & Clark Streets) has plenty of restaurants, shops, coffee shops, there are a few drugstores, and I saw a health food store around the corner. When I checked in, I was pleasantly surprised by the professionalism and courtesy of the gentlemen working the desk, and the comfy seating near the fire. My room was on the 3rd floor, a queen suite with the bed in an adjoining room. The room was charming and comfortable, nicely decorated and well-equipped. It was like a tiny apartment, and I loved it. In the bathroom, they use Gilchrist & Soames Essentiel Elements lavender-scented products. The bed was very comfortable, with plenty of pillows and a soft blanket at the bottom of the bed. Downstairs, they provide coffee and hot water for tea or cocoa, and serve a continental breakfast in the morning. I definitely recommend this hotel, though you should be aware of the possibility of noise from the L station next door.

Reviews.Title: “City Suites close to boystown”
Reviews.Author: LarryB16
Reviews.Content: Very nice, close walk to all the bars and restaurants on Halsted. Supposedly this was Al Capones hangout in the twenties. Historic feel to it; I have stayed here many times.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place for a fun trip”
Reviews.Author: bagadonutz
Reviews.Content: Nice small hotel right next to the red line - you can be downtown in just a few minutes. Great staff - friendly and helpful. Fast and easy wireless internet. Very fun neighborhood even though there seems to be a lot of small businesses struggling - something for everyone - try Schuba's down the street for a great place to drink and listen to music. A lot of second-hand stores for scoring that hard-to-find book or record album or even a members-only jacket. I would recommend this for a Cub's game but I don't recommend going to a Cub's game for any reason (unless they are playing the White Sox).

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: Brussels_Raider
Reviews.Content: Great location in a lively safe neigbourhood. Coffee/tea 24/7, breakfast in the morning, cookies in the afternoon, a diner across the street, bars and restaurants just a block away,... a perfect location for any adventurer. The hotel is right next to the Belmont train stop so if you're a light sleeper that might be a bit of an issue but that's really the only thing that could stop you from booking this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel and great value in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: biomik
Reviews.Content: This is nice hotel located next door to convenient Belmont station. I was attending a business meeting in downtown Chicago (McCormick Place) and decided to save some money for my company (paying $120 a night instead of +$300 for a downtown hotel). In all, I have no regrets, taking subway in the morning was very pleasant and energizing. The hotel itself is nothing super but nice, clean, spacious etc. My room was a notch too noisy (facing the 'L') but it did not bother me much. The neighborhood surrounding the hotel is nice, fairly safe, lots of restaurants, shops and famous Boystown is nearby (for those interested). I think it is outstanding value in an expensive city.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint, friendly, convenient”
Reviews.Author: AnonymousBean
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here with 2 of our friends on a whim the night we went to a concert at the Metro. It was pretty close and we needed a place to stay. I am so happy we stumbled upon this hotel. Our room had two queen beds, but a hallway separated the beds so it was like having 2 rooms. It was great for saving money, but yet providing a little privacy being in the same room with the other couple. The front desk staff was friendly, our room and bathroom were huge and there was a really nice contintental breakfast in the morning. It's a little hard to find, we drove past it about 3 times, so keep your eyes peeled. We had a wonderful stay and would definitely go back if we're ever in the area and need to spend the night and have the money. It is a bit pricey for an unplanned night's stay.

Reviews.Title: “So easy, so nice, so fun”
Reviews.Author: buck70
Reviews.Content: Hanging out in the Halsted Area, North of Chicago? This would be one of the most convienent, places to stay in that area. The City Suites is so accessable from Midway or O'hare airports via train service at the Belmont stop and all you have to do is just step off the train and literally less than 100 steps, there you are. The hotel has a quiet small lobby but seemed very clean and check-in was easy. Take the stairs if you are claustophobic for the limit of 3 people on the small elevator would make even the bravest a little timid. Nice decor throughout the lobby and hallways as well as very nice appointments in the rooms of this all suite hotel. Fluffy pillows on the bed, flat panel televeisions, nicely tiled bathroom, pretty spacious room for 3 adults rooming together. They even supply you with shower gel, shampoo, conditioner, and lotion in the bathroom along with robes that you can purchase if you like, after your stay. Iron and a small Ironing board were provided, even a fridge for keeping beverages or food. Contential breakfast was served in the morning and I did hear of a reception in the afternoon/evening that I didn't partake in. The hotel is located near all the bars, shopping and restaurants that wonderful North Chicago has to offer and the vibrant, colorful North Halsted area is always something to see reguardless of race, culture, creed or sexuality.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a real Chi-town experience. We loved it.”
Reviews.Author: PickieBeecher
Reviews.Content: We're Chicago natives who were in town to visit colleges with our son. Usually when we visit the city (at least a couple times/year) we stay in the Loop or off the Mag Mile because we're going to plays, museums, etc. We've been looking for a place to stay further North in our old 'stomping grounds' and we're so glad we found City Suites! If you're not a seasoned traveler and have trouble figuring out how to navigate in a city, or how to recognize what's dodgy and what's not, you might have issues staying here. The Belmont neighborhood is diverse, eclectic and vibrant - and can be a little kooky, too. We never felt unsafe but we're familiar with the area. You're not in Kansas anymore, but thank the gods for that. We walk everywhere and allowed our 17-year-old son his freedom to do so, too - he's familiar with the city's street grid and public transit system. There's so much to do and see and the el is there to take you anywhere you want to go. Yes, the rooms are smallish (except for the Executive Suites to which which we were very kindly upgraded, giving us and our sometimes-surly teen some trip-saving space) and the elevator is tiny but it's a 1930's era building after all. It's reminiscent of European hotels. If your rooms are on the west/el train side of the building you will hear the trains and door chimes/announcements. Yes, sometimes you will hear street noise, too, especially over weekends. But this is just the city -it's hard for me to understand why people would choose to stay in a vibrant neighborhood hotel and then complain about the vibrant neighborhood. We found the hotel staff to be incredibly responsive, friendly and attentive. The rooms were impeccably clean and comfortable, as was the lobby. The breakfast is great and you can get coffee and tea throughout the day, plus cookies in the afternoon, which is a great respite from all your walking around and exploring. The parking is quite reasonable for hotel/city parking and a godsend because street parking is impossible in Chicago (and you'd better believe those Lincoln towing signs). We will certainly be back. As mentioned, we just wish we'd found City Suites sooner. Thanks to the City Suites staff for making our stay so fun and memorable. =)

Reviews.Title: “Noise, sloppy housekeeping, and a very unpleasant run-in......”
Reviews.Author: exmontrealer
Reviews.Content: Let me start with the most important part of my experience at City Suites: My boyfriend, who's black, was greeted by one of the front desk staff with a cold stare and a stern "What floor are you on?" a couple days into our stay. When he told the attendant our room number, she mumbled something about a guest's missing property. We still can't figure out what she meant, but I think you get the point. In 2009, in Chicago, we had hoped for better. Here's the other critical part of our experience: Anyone who says you can ignore sounds from "El" trains next to the hotel is lying. The noise in rooms is brutal. You hear everything -- trains pulling in and out, conductors' voices, door-closing chimes. We also woke up to construction outside our window from 7am both weekdays of our stay. Rooms don't seem to be soundproofed, so sounds almost seemed amplified. Some less important points, but equally unpleasant: Housekeeping was lazy, leaving towels strewn on sofas and cabinet doors. I've never stayed in a hotel where the cleaners didn't return towels to the bathroom, or just replace them. FInally, the property's in poor shape. While the lobby's clean, the facilities in general feel more "hostel" than "hotel". Bottom line: I'm staying at the Days Inn next time I'm in Chicago. Better value, better location, better hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Gem of a hotel in an okay area”
Reviews.Author: caligirlburb
Reviews.Content: This hotel is part of the Green Hotels Association and really tries to offer you a green hotel experience. It is clean. The staff is very nice. It is a quiet hotel. It is in the Lakeview neighborhood area of Chicago city proper -- apparently one of the best and safest neighborhoods in the actual city's limits. The area appears sketchy but I was assured by several locals that it is generally safe -- just be smart. As one would in a big city, keep your bags close to your body, your wallet in your front pocket, and be aware. There are a number of nice little clothing boutiques around this hotel. It is literally right next to the metro train (you don't hear the train indoors -- no worries). Lots of young, hip twenty-somethings live in this area. A few blocks down is a heavy gay neighborhood. I went to a Thai restaurant a few doors down from the hotel for some inexpensive, good food and noticed there were a number of gay couples in the restaurant, one of those couples was even dressed in drag. A Jamba Juice and Clark's Nuts are across the street from the hotel. Not knowing the area made me feel nervous, but I just played it safe and was actually very comfortable. The people in the area are very pleasant and customer friendly. They have a continental breakfast downstairs in the morning -- but I didn't try it, so I can't comment. It's very easy to ride the travel from the hotel or get a cab. They have free internet service. Would I recommend, I am saying yes -- mostly because of the good customer service and green hotel experience. I'm more of a suburb girl, so the city neighborhood thing made me nervous -- I'm not going to discount this hotel for that reason.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel for the $ in Lakeview”
Reviews.Author: OhioDerf
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights. Excellent staff, location and value. Adequate, clean rooms with a decent continental breakfast thrown in for good measure. Hotel staff held our bags from check out til we left for airport late in the day on Sunday and refused a tip. Directly next to Belmont stop on red/brown line. Didn't notice any noise from train although other reviews did mention it. We have reservations for our trip in June. Rooms are more in summer but still not as much as other lesser hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Not as noisy as some lead you to believe”
Reviews.Author: topthis67
Reviews.Content: Clean hotel, nicely updated, FREE WI-FI. Parking is $22 a night, about average for a metropolitain area. Rooms are on the small side, but not too small for a short stay. Great price for a central location. This hotel is next to the EL, we stayed in a room on the West side but hardly noticed the trains. Other reviewers said they couldn't sleep they were so noisy. We did not have this problem at all. Would definately stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: infrequenttaveler
Reviews.Content: Hotel staff was great, very friendly and accomdating. The room was small, but had all the amenities we needed and was very clean. The bathroom was great, airy and bright with a double shower head for a great shower. We were attending a Cubs game and Wrigley was easily within walking distance. Lots of great restaurants within a few blocks as well.

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: FunKYBear
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel. The staff was very nice and it's close to Boys Town and the "L" Station. The rooms are a bit small, but they are very nice. The continental breakfast was decent. We'll definitley stay here again!!

Reviews.Title: “What a dump”
Reviews.Author: BusinessTraveler90
Reviews.Content: Pros: 1. Free internet 2. Right next to Belmont Station (red, brown, purple lines) 3. Lots of t.v. channels 4. Decent breakfast selection... not that healthy though. 5. Close to a bunch of lackluster food options 6. Some staff members were nice Cons 1. The hallways smelled of urine and smoke (disgusting!) 2. The rooms and restrooms are small and cramped 3. The street noise and noise from the train is loud, especially at night 4. The area is dangerous at night. Every single shop had a police warning posted, and I saw 9 cruisers pull up to Belmont station and arrest two people. At night, random people holler up and down the street. 5. Elevator is rickety and small I don't recommend this hotel for business travelers. It's a step up from a European youth hostel. It's hard to believe this hotel is in the same chain as the Georgian in Santa Monica! For those with disabilities, many of the stops on the El are not handicapped accessible. The Belmont station is not accessible.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED the room, hated the neighbors!”
Reviews.Author: CaliTraveller76
Reviews.Content: The location is brilliant. You're right next to The EL (The Red Line) which takes you anywhere (Downtown or North) fast. If you are looking for a hotel close to the gay area of town, this is just blocks away. Also, there is great shopping and restaurants RIGHT outside your door. The staff is VERY nice and our double room was great. Clean, good size, a/c, roomy bathroom. NOTHING was wrong with the room. We were on the side of the building away from the train and we heard absolutely nothing that I have read in other reviews. However, it was St. Patrick's Day weekend and the people in rooms throughout our floor were making SO much noise (even around 3 and 4 am) that it was very disappointing the hotel staff did NOTHING to silence them. Other than that I would stay here over and over again... just not on a 'let's get drunk' holiday weekend...

Reviews.Title: “Affordable and Clean, but a bit noisy”
Reviews.Author: Pluma002
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the City Suites for a long weekend, and it was well worth the money. We were close to all our friends in Lincoln Park, and right around a bunch of restaurants at Clark and Belmont. Our room was very clean, and there was free wireless internet, which was very helpful. Luckily, we had a room that did not face the train line, so it was not too noisy. It is very convenient the train stop is only one block away, but it was loud!! I can't imagine what the rooms facing the line must have heard. All in all, the hotel was budget friendly and had all the basics we were looking for: good coffee, free wireless, a clean bathroom. Will come back next time we're in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Great European Style Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mike3
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the City Suites Hotel on Belmont in Chicago on December 25th - December 28th. We had a fantastic time at the hotel. The hotel is clean and very nicely decorated. It seems like a hotel you would stay at in London, Paris, or Madrid. The people at the front dest could not have been nicer or more helpful. The location on Belmont is wonderful. Walking distance to many great restaurants in the area (try the Asian restaurant a couple door down by the hotel). The rooms were not large, but adequate and very clean. This was my second stay at the City Suites and I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, very convenient, very friendly! I'm going back!”
Reviews.Author: kad4ever
Reviews.Content: I chose the City Suites because of it's close proximity to the Blue Man Group theater, but I was very happy with my choice. Staff was great, parking was close, and free (I hate getting gouged for parking at downtown hotels)! This hotel is a typical older city hotel and the rooms are comfortable, but not palatial. Service was friendly and helpful, neither of us had any problem sleeping and we were on the El side. The neighborhood is wonderfully eclectic, and Clarke's (right across the street) served me the best damned breakfast I ever ate! I'm going back with my daughters to see BMG, and I'll definitely stay at the City Suites again, but this time I'm going to take the El from O'Hare - it should be a great taste of Chicago and the station is about 50 feet from the hotel's front door!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at the City Suites”
Reviews.Author: purdue01
Reviews.Content: We had four guys stay in one room on a weekend to the Cubs game. The room had a separate living room an bedroom. Four slept very comfortable. The room was very clean with nice updates for an older building. It was located within a 10 minute or less walk from Wrigley Field in a nice neighborhood. They offer a nice complimentary continental breakfast. It is a little pricey but I would stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Good for a trip to Wrigley”
Reviews.Author: Kentucky123
Reviews.Content: Good for a trip to Wrigley, easy 5-6 block walk, plenty of bars and good places to eat. The place is old, but everything in that area is older. El was not a bother at all. I would stay here again, if I was going to Wrigley.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice in Lakeview/Wrigley”
Reviews.Author: omafig
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at the City Suites. While we booked a regular Queen room, we were allowed a very early check in (noon) and given a double suite instead. The room was very clean, comfortable and stocked with wonderfully fluffy robes and very good quality personal amenities (including bath salts--a nice touch). The bedroom and sitting rooms were attractively decorated as was the bathroom. I especially appreciated modern design that was considerate of the original architecture. (As in many hotels, it would help to have additional towel bars installed in the bathroom) Good coffee and fresh fruit are both available in the lobby all day. A continental breakfast is offered every morning and cookies are served in the afternoon. This small, neighborhood hotel is very conveniently located. We were within five blocks of Wrigley Field and a block from all the bars/restaurants along Clark. The Belmont El station is right next door--our room backed up to it and was surprisingly quiet. Hotel staff is outstanding--very friendly, accomodating and ready to help with directions, airline boarding passes, etc. We'll definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Neutral/Average”
Reviews.Author: RockNuvell
Reviews.Content: Stayed here last winter for one night and from the area. It's exactly as you see it; a darkish hotel room, clean, American, decent beds. It is an average hotel room. Please, no delusions of grandeur here, and worth $125 - $150 a night, not a penny more, though you'll prob pay more. Know the neighbourhood well, good hood, boys town to the east and Wrigley to the north. Southport area is sweet, just west, bunch of great bars and hotel is right by the brown and red line on the El. Nothing more, nothing less.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the City Suites”
Reviews.Author: MrSeKrEt
Reviews.Content: We had a fabulous time at the City Suites. The front desk was very helpful and knowledgeable. The rooms were CLEAN and comfortable. The continental breakfast had a nice choice of American classics. The location is prime and to anyone complaining about the noise from the train, you are in a huge city! You can't choose to be close to public transportation and complain about the noise. Besides, we had a room on the train side and it wasn't as bad as we thought it might be.Â  Further more, we also stayed while they were changing the carpet and we did not have any problems what so ever with the noise or ruckus. It seemed everyone in the hotel was up and taking breakfast before they started working.Â  Over all, we loved the atmosphere and the personable and friendly staff. Our trip was delightful and we will certainly be coming back! THANK YOU!

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Nice”
Reviews.Author: soundasleep
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the City Suites on 04/2 - 04/06. I was concerned when I saw the rooms on the website. I dont know how it happend, but the upgraded me to one of the king rooms. The Bathroom was beautiful, the bedroom was very plush. The tv in the sitting room did not seem to work, but that seems like a petty thing to complain about. The staff were extremely helpful helping me get to the the restaurants I had reservations at, plus they gave me ideas on where to go in boystown. Berlin is just across the street, Ann Sathers or Orange for the mornings. Pretty cool place.

Reviews.Title: “Could be better”
Reviews.Author: seessels
Reviews.Content: The rooms were very nice and roomy, but two things occurred during our stay that makes my unhappy. They started changing the carpet inthe hallway at 8:30, which was not the bad thing the bad thing was that the manager would not apologize for it, instead she told us "we picked the room." The other thing was the heat had a mind of its own. We woke up @6:30 in the morning freezing one morning and had to call the front-desk, to which they responded â€œI will check the boiler,â€� 30minutes later you can hear it start to kick on.

Reviews.Title: “Hellish”
Reviews.Author: loebus
Reviews.Content: I'm writing this in the hotel at 4 AM as I can't sleep and have been tossing and turning for 5 hours now. My alarm goes off in two hours, and I literally haven't gotten a wink of sleep. I can hear that at least one of my neighbors is having similar troubles, as the walls are so thin I can hear him tossing and turning and grunting every couple of minutes as well. And the train. Oh yes, the train is right outside my window, and comes every 5 minutes or so, sounding like a jet airplane landing in the bathroom. I'm paying Them for this?

Reviews.Title: “highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: john_68547
Reviews.Content: all the reviews i read complained about the small room and being next to the el. yes the room was small, you're in the heart of the city! yes it was next to the el, it wasn't any noiser than the general street noise, again you're in the heart of one of the busiest area of a major city! the room was very nicely decorated and very clean. large bathroom. staff was very nice. continental breakfast was far nicer than a lot that i've had. highly recommend staying here for cub games, one el stop away!

Reviews.Title: “wonderfull stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: wonderfull stay, you can find there everything what you are lokking for: very friendly staff, verry clean rooms, great breakfast, great location- close to everything- shoping, restaurants Stay there

Reviews.Title: “A Memboriable Stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife found this lovely hotel on the internet and booked through their own web site which offers the lowest rate and found it to be the best little hotel that Chicago has to offer. I was here for a Cubs game and was disappointed in a Cubs loss but excited about this great find in th City Suites. Staff is excellent and close to a subway station and walking distace to Wrigley Field.

Reviews.Title: “feel at home”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I did stay at this hotel many times, but I see improvement everytime when i go there (on staff -friendly and helpful, clean room, breakfast better and better) I was again on Oct 05, and I found a new mattresses The hotel is magnificent and we have never experienced such incredible plesure I feel like that is my home

Reviews.Title: “Great place City Suites Hotel”
Reviews.Author: herd4sheep
Reviews.Content: While in Chicago we picked our hotel so it was within walking distance to Wrigley Field. City Suites Hotel is an older building on W. Belmont Ave. We enjoyed the surroundings and the coziness of the hotel. The rooms have an older charm about them and are clean and comfortable. Russell, at the front desk, was a tremedous help with recommending places to eat and places to take two teenage boys while visiting. He helped make our trip easy to enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Adorable, comfortable room. Good value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I came to look at a few colleges in Chicago. We just needed a decent room in a convenient location. This hotel more than met our expectations. We were a little surprised when we found the hotel was 2 shops from the El station, but we never heard any train noise. We arrived at 6am, and the hotel let us check in early. We had only reserved a "room" not a suite, and they gave us a discount when me mentioned we were touring Loyola. I think they upgraded us. Our room was like a junior suite...bedroom with 2 twins, a TV, desk and 2 nightstands. The "living room" had no door but had a loveseat/bed, an easy chair, table and another TV. All the furniture was light wood and looked pretty new. The bathroom was classic 1930s- small tiles on the floor, white subway wall tiles- looked straight from Restoration Hardware! The best was that the floor was heated! Felt so nice! They allowed us to eat breakfast on our arrival as well as departure date- nothing fancy...Tea, coffee, fruits and pastries. All in all, we were very happy here. My only complaint was that the desk clerk told me it would take 30 minutes on the El to get to the airport at 6 am. It was closer to an hour, and we almost missed our flight!!

Reviews.Title: “Shabby hotel in shabby neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The best thing I can say about this place is that it's steps from an El station, so that a quick trip to the Loop area is no problem. Unfortunately, that also means that you can hear the El rumbling every few munites in the day and throughout the night. The room we had was spacious but shabby, not at all what I had imagined from the pictures on the Internet. My companion had stayed a few nights before in a fine Chicago hotel for about the same price, so she was especially unimpressed. Some muight regard the neighborhood as funky and happening (restaurants, nightclubs), but dirty and shabby are equally apt (--- shops, street people). In view of recommendations from well-known travel guides, this place was a real disappointment.

Reviews.Title: “Location a huge asset”
Reviews.Author: nitebird
Reviews.Content: We stayed at City Suites for 4 nights. Our room was clean, quiet, and roomy. The convenience of the El only a few doors down is great, as is having the Halsted nightlife only a couple of blocks away. Great Chicago pizza and hot dogs nearby. The staff was helpful and friendly- Russ went above and beyond with his guidance on dining and entertainment for our stay. Coffee and tea are available throughout the day and evening. I have stayed here in the past and it will be my only choice next time as well.

Reviews.Title: “one room does not make a siute”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at City Suites Saturday May 7, 2005. We reserved a "King Suite" which was purported to be a suite with a fold out couch bed. We needed a suite so that our daughter in law could use it while we could maintain or privacy. In fact the room was not a "suite" at all, just a room with a half wall between a seating area and a king bed. No privacy at all. I espressed my concerns to the on duty manager Ross. Ross told me in a very rude and condescending manner that If I hadn't booked the room on "Cheap hotels Dot Com" I would have known that the room was not a "suite" but really a "Junior Suite." He then told me that he was canceling our reservation and was giong to find us a "real suite that will cost your ------ $500.00." If he were my employee he would be immediately fired. Ther web page, which I referred to before I CALLED and asked numerous questions before I made reservations at the link provided intimates that City Suites Hotel does indeed have suites. El noise all night long and lousy continental breakfast, not worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the City Suites on Saturday, April 30th for one night. We booked a standard queen room (not a suite) since we were not planning on spending much time in the room. The room was a bit larger than most boutique hotels in a city. The bathroom had a bit more room as well. We had no problem with noise as mentioned in other posts. The room was very quite. The best asset of this hotel is the location. We came in for a concert and wanted to bar hop on Halsted after the show. This hotel is perfect as Halsted is only a block away. There are also plenty of shops and good restaurants nearby. There is a train station right next door which makes getting around the city easy. Overall the hotel is a good value.

Reviews.Title: “Paper thin walls”
Reviews.Author: KBMS
Reviews.Content: We got a decent price for out hotel room so I can't complain about that. The rooms were a bit small but nicely decorated and clean. I really liked the hotel for its location and style. The only problem we had was the paper thin walls. After celebrating all night we only wanted a good sleep before driving back to the suburbs in the morning. All we heard was a baby crying through out the night, people talking in their rooms, and footsteps constantly in the hallway. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone for that reason. I would reconsider if they renovated with some sound proofing.

Reviews.Title: “I LOVE THIS HOTEL!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at City Suites hotel every year for the past 8 years, when my friends and I come at the end of June for the exciting parade weekend in "Boys-Town" Chicago. The hotel is perfect, comfortable, convenient to all the areas we like to visit, including our favourite health club, which is within walking distance of the hotel! The staff is always helpful and friendly. Even one year, they had a water main break on the day of our arrival, and they put my entire party (of 6 people) up in the Quality Inn, on Michigan Ave., just for one night, totally free of charge, including dinner and cocktails, as well as crediting our first night at City Suites! Restaurants, shopping, night-clubs, all within walking distance, as well as the conventient "El" station right outside the hotel doors! I recommend this hotel to everyone!

HotelInfo.Name: City Suites Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 933 West Belmont Ave., Chicago, IL 60657
